Potato___Early_blight: Use fungicides such as Mancozeb or Chlorothalonil. Remove infected leaves and avoid overhead watering.
Potato___Late_blight: Apply fungicides containing Metalaxyl. Remove affected plants and improve air circulation. Do not compost infected material.
Potato___healthy: No treatment necessary. Maintain good agricultural practices to keep plants healthy.
Tomato___Bacterial_spot: Apply copper-based bactericides. Avoid working in wet fields to reduce spread.
Tomato___Early_blight: Spray fungicides like Azoxystrobin. Rotate crops yearly and use disease-free seeds.
Tomato___Late_blight: Use fungicides with chlorothalonil or mancozeb. Destroy infected plants immediately.
Tomato___Leaf_Mold: Improve ventilation. Use fungicides such as mancozeb or copper oxychloride.
Tomato___healthy: No treatment necessary. Maintain good irrigation and spacing practices.
Corn_(maize)___Common_rust_: Apply fungicides like azoxystrobin if infection is severe. Choose resistant hybrids.
Corn_(maize)___Northern_Leaf_Blight: Use fungicides such as propiconazole. Ensure crop rotation and field sanitation.
Corn_(maize)___Cercospora_leaf_spot Gray: Avoid overhead irrigation. Apply fungicides and plant resistant hybrids.
Corn_(maize)___healthy: No treatment necessary. Maintain crop rotation and clean field residue.
